attr_description: you can buy them separately or in a set, i recommend getting several thicknesses so your partner can experience with several painting techniques
they're sold in a variety of sizes and are very cheap. i'd recommend getting your partner a large canvas and a small one.

a notebook with high-quality paper and blank pages. there are different types of sketchbooks intended for painting, drawing and sketching - i recommend you to consult the shopkeeper which one suites your partner the best.

high quality markers, "Tombow" is just the brand. they are double-sided (one thick side, and one thin side). they are water-based, and are better suited for small coloring projects, such as journaling and doodling
high quality markers, "Copic" is just the brand. they are alcohol-based, and are suited for professional illustrations and drawings.
mid-quality permanent markers, can be used on a variety of surfaces such as metal and plastic

Water Colors are small condensed color blocks, that are intended to be diluted with water and painted with. they are great for outdoor painting since the sets are very compact, and are easy to learn - there are tons of youtube videos that teach watercolor techniques
an actual charcoal! it's an interesting drawing material to experience with for people who like pencil drawing. smirs very easily, and has a deep black color
dries quick, a great choice for beginners as well as professional painters. i personally paint with acrylics only since they're cheap, opaque, get dry quickly and don't smell as much as oil paint.
a stand for canvas painting. it allows the painter to stand while he/she paints
a palette for colors. literally. you gotta smear the colors somewhere O_O
draws in 3D using a plastic fillament, it's a very cool gift
IT ERASES PENCILS LOL
IT SHARPENS PENCILS LOL
a case to store brushes, comfortable for carrying
a case to store pencils, comfortable for carrying
embroidery is the craft of decorating fabric using a needle to apply thread or yarn. a premade kit will contain a needle, a hoop and yarn

opaque, high-quality, permanent markers, "POSCA" is just the brand. great for sketching, professional painting and for street-art since they stay on all surfaces. i personally use them for body painting and street-art
regular graphite pencils, great for aspiring artists who wish to learn how to sketch
regular colorful pencils, great for aspiring artists who want to learn how to draw colorfully

Calligraphy is decorative handwriting and lettering, it's like the letters you see in old books. great for people who like writing, the pens are designed for this purpose and i personally love this type of art, it's so elegant
great pens for everyday writing, journaling, and for sketching. comes in many colors. "Pilot" is just the brand
great for sketching. they come in different widths - great for aspiring artists who like to sketch, they have a very deep color. "Micron" is just the brand

a wooden doll, with fully poseable joints and limbs to allow you to position the figure in whichever poses you like. great for learning how to draw a human in different poses, i personally recommend it helped me a lot and serves as a great pet since it doesn't poop, is very quiet, and it doesn't need to be fed.
pom-poms, popsicle sticks, wooden cubes, googly eyes, and more. you'll need to get glue to assemble it all, very fun and random i recommend

plastic models made for assembling. the kits come with glue, a manual the the plastic pieces that make the model. there are models of tanks, airplanes, ships, artillary, and more. i personally started crafting by assembling these when i was a kid, it's very therapeutic.
paper intended for origami, which is the art of paper folding. kits contain different colors of paper
you sculpt it and put it in the oven to dry, very fun. you can get your partner several colors to experience with. "Fimo" id just the brand
air-dry clay. you sculpt and let it dry for a day. "DAS" is just the brand.
go straight in to the store, and ask where are the premade art kits are. choose one that you think that your partner would like, buy it and you're done
buy it online or in an Art Stores, so your partner will be able to choose whatever s.he likes
search for workshops in funzing or eventbrite. a one-time ceramics workshop for example
there are several organization that do paint dates for couples or group of friends in bars around the city. OR - DM me and i'll organize you a cheaper solution :)
attr_stores: Abraham Hostel, Funzing, Paint Date Organization, Paint & Pint Organization, Me :)

attr_description: small beads, great for creating necklaces and bracelets for beginner jewelery makers. get your partner several colors and a plastic cord (חוט דייגים)
